Roelof Frederik "Pik" Botha, DMS (27 April 1932 – 12 October 2018) was a South African politician. He served as the country's foreign minister in the last years of the apartheid era.
Botha was nicknamed 'Pik' (short for "pikkewyn", Afrikaans for 'penguin') because of a perceived likeness to a penguin in his stance, accentuated when he wore a suit.
In 2000, Botha declared his support for Presidents Nelson Mandela and Thabo Mbeki.
Botha died on 12 October 2018 at his home in Pretoria at the age of 86.
